page.title: 20 Agricultural Review
page.content:
Most of the farmland in the area is owned by Lord Hertford and is part of the Ragley Estate.It is run by Peter Crabtree,the estate manager of Ragley.A small area of farmland is made up of small,privately owned farms which grow mainly wheat and barley crops.There is also grass land used to graze mostly sheep although there are some dairy cattle in the area. The woodland is found mainly on steep banks or on hills where it would be difficult to grow crops and to use machinery.Weethly wood runs N-S along a slope to the west of the area. Pastural land is also found mostly on banks or hills for the same reason. The arable crops are grown on flat land.
Survey compiled by pupils of 2M and 2S, Alcester Grammar School,summer 1985.
